artist: Artist: after Peter Henderson; Engraver: Thomas Burke; Engraver: Frederick Lewis; Publisher: Dr. Robert John Thornton
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
description: Color-printed illustration of the Sacred Egyptian Bean (Nympaea nelumbo)
inscription: In plate, lower left: Henderson. pinxt.; lower center: The Sacred Egyptian Bean / London, Published Decr. 1, 1804, by Dr. Thornton.; lower right: Burke & Lewis sculpt.
medium: Color aquatint, mezzotint, stipple engraving, and line engraving, inked à la poupée, with hand-coloring on cream wove paper
portfolio: From "New Illustration of the Sexual System of Carolus von Linnaeus, Part Three: The Temple of Flora" (London, 1799-1807)
provenance: Dwight and Helen Minnich, Minneapolis; sold to MIA, 1966.
title: The Sacred Egyptian Bean, plate 31 from Robert Thorton's "The Temple of Flora"
